author: sky.cactus
content: Any idea who will be attending besides me and Lightclient?

author: 0xraino
content: üôã‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

author: 0xraino
content: I read what's up on the github, I'm confused why the RLP Envelope isn't higher than Opaque bytes in people's minds but generally in agreement about everything else.

author: sky.cactus
content: Because you cannot easily/reliably differentiate between legacy transactions and typed transactions.

author: sky.cactus
content: Which kind of defeats the purpose of typed transactions.  üôÇ

author: draganrakita
content: Will be there :)

author: 0xraino
content: I think it'd still be the same thing it is now, just 1 level "deeper" in the RLP nesting. In our stream decoder we can ask if the next item is a list and switch on that. It does take up more space though so I'm not necessarily advocating for it as the top choice, was just confused about the ranking.

author: sky.cactus
content: Any chance someone from Geth and Nethermind will be there to get good representation from all of the major clients?

author: sky.cactus
content: A legacy transaction's nonce can be `1`, which would be the same as a 2718 transaction's first item.

author: sky.cactus
content: Also, a big part of 2718 was to avoid having to ensure that all transaction types are carefully constructed to not conflict with each other.

author: sky.cactus
content: And also to avoid having to do things like "if the transaction's second item is a list then do X, else to Y".

author: sky.cactus
content: We ideally want to be able to just switch on one consistent thing for all transaction types.

author: 0xraino
content: Ahhh

author: 0xraino
content: You're right.

author: 0xraino
content: On the same page now
